title: The men with secret toilet anxiety - and why it's more common than you think
text:
When Andrew Smith was a young man, he used to have to plan out every move he made during the day so he wasn’t caught needing to pee while out of his home. When he was in public, a constant fear would tick over in the back of his mind: the risk that he’d need to use a public bathroom, and that he’d have to pee in a urinal – and wouldn’t be able to.

“I’ve had a shy bladder all my life,” the 73-year-old chair of the UK Paruresis Trust explains. Paruresis is the medical term for shy bladder syndrome – a paralysing fear of peeing publicly that can in its milder stages cause men to stand uncomfortably next to others at urinals trying to pee, and at its worst can result in sufferers to be housebound...
